intro: Lophothecium boliviense, commonly known as the Bolivian liverwort, is a species of non-vascular plant belonging to the family Marchantiaceae. It is characterized by its leafy thallus, which is typically flat and closely appressed to the substrate. The plant exhibits a complex thallus structure with distinct lobes and a central axis, often covered in small, water-retaining structures called gemmae. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in tropical and subtropical regions. Lophothecium boliviense plays a role in soil stabilization and nutrient cycling in its native habitats.
